meanings.sent1: The overloud music at the party hurt my ears.
meanings.sent2: The neighbors complained about the overloud music coming from our house.
meanings.sent3: The overloud laughter from the children filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent4: The overloud colors of the painting clashed with the rest of the decor.
meanings.sent5: The overloud thunder made the windows rattle in their frames.

meanings.definition: To speak or make a sound too loudly.
meanings.sent1: Please don't overloud your voice in the library.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the student to stop overlouding during the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The parrot overlouded the conversation with its squawking.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock overlouded the peaceful morning with its ringing.
meanings.sent5: The toddler overlouded the room with his enthusiastic singing.
